ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.2_0: an association had prepared a meal together with robes for the Sangha. They said,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.3_0: intending to offer the robes after giving the meal.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.4_0: But the monks from the group of six went to that association
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.8_0: We’ve prepared our annual alms-offering together with robes for the Sangha.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.10_0: But since we’re staying here, we look to you for support.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.11_0: If you don’t give to us, who will?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.13_0: Being pressured by the monks from the group of six, that association gave the prepared robes to them and served the food to the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.14_0: The monks who knew that a meal together with robes had been prepared for the Sangha, but who did not know that the robes had been given to those monks from the group six, said,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.17_0: The monks from the group of six got the robe-cloth as they wanted.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.18_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.19_0: “How can the monks from the group of six divert to themselves things they know were intended for the Sangha?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.20_0: After criticizing those monks in many ways, they told the Buddha ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.21_0: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.24_0: “... Foolish men, how can you divert to yourselves things that you know were intended for the Sangha?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.25_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.26_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.27.1_0: ‘If a monk diverts to himself material support that he knows was intended for the Sangha, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.4_0: ...The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.6_0: he knows by himself or others have told him or the donor has told him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.8_0: given to the Sangha, given up to the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.10_0: robes, almsfood, dwellings, and medicinal requisites to help when sick.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.10_1: Even if the wind is bitter
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.13_0: If he diverts it to himself, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.14_0: When he gets the robe-cloth, it becomes subject to relinquishment.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.15_0: The blanket should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.16_0: “And, monks, it should be relinquished like this. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.18_0: ‘Venerables, this thing which I diverted to myself knowing that it was intended for the Sangha is to be relinquished.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.19_0: I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.22_0: ‘I give this robe-cloth back to you.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.23.1_0: If it is intended for the Sangha and he perceives it as such, and he diverts it to himself, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.24_0: If it is intended for the Sangha, but he is unsure of it, and he diverts it to himself, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.25_0: If it is intended for the Sangha, but he does not perceives it as such, and he diverts it to himself, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.26_0: If it is intended for one Sangha and he diverts it to another Sangha or to a shrine, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.27_0: If it is intended for one shrine and he diverts it to another shrine or to a sangha or to an individual, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.28_0: If it is intended for an individual and he diverts it to another individual or to a sangha or to a shrine, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.29_0: If it is not intended for the Sangha, but he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.30_0: If it is not intended for the Sangha, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.31_0: If it is not intended for the Sangha and he does not perceive it as such, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.32.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.33_0: Where does someone give to you? Where are you asking about your wealth, wherever you want, and your mind is eager for a long time? Or if you get made the gift of that, your mind becomes confident, settled, and decided about it.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.35_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.36_0: The tenth rule, the training rule on what is intended, is finished.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.37_0: The third sub-chapter on almsbowls is finished.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.40_0: Rainy season, the fifth on a gift;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.43_0: “Venerables, the thirty rules on relinquishment and confession have been recited.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.44_0: In regard to this I ask you,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.50_0: You are pure in this and therefore silent.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.52_0: The chapter on offenses entailing relinquishment is finished.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.53_0: The canonical text on offenses entailing expulsion is finished.
